description: From Middle English bedmaker, bedmakere, equivalent to bed +‎ maker. Cognate with Saterland Frisian Bäädmoaker (“bedmaker”), West Frisian bêdmakker (“bedmaker”), Dutch beddenmaker (“bedmaker”), German Bettmacher (“bedmaker”).

entries.meaning: (Cambridge University, formal or historical) A bedder.
examples: Bedmakers have to be comic and dishonest. It is expected of them. In a picture of university life it is their only function.
